Tinggalkan PSS Sleman, Brian Ferreira: Semoga Kita Berjodoh Lagi
07 Nov 2019, 03:58 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ekspresi gelandang serang PSS Sleman, Brian Ferreira, tampak dingin saat menyaksikan timnya berjibaku menundukkan pemuncak klasemen sementara Liga 1 2019, Bali United di Stadion Maguwoharjo Sleman Rabu sore itu, 6 November 2019.
Pemain 25 tahun berdarah Argentina-Irak itu, tampak dari kursi penonton VVIP Stadion Maguwoharjo, hanya sesekali terlihat gemas saat rekannya rekannya mendapat peluang emas, namun gagal mengeksekusinya menjadi gol.
PSS Sleman harus mengakhiri laga kandang kontra Bali United sore itu dengan skor 0-0, tanpa diperkuat kembali Brian yang sudah absen pada tiga laga terakhir Super Elang Jawa karena cedera tak kunjung pulih.
Usai laga PSS kontra Bali itu, pemain berpaspor Irak tersebut turun dari tribunnya lalu berjalan menuju tengah lapangan dan mengucapkan salam perpisahan nan haru dengan di hadapan belasan ribu suporter PSS yang memadati stadion.
Mesin gol terbanyak kedua Laskar Sembada yang sudah melakoni 20 pertandingan dengan torehan sembilan gol dan lima umpan itu pamit akan pulang ke kampung halamannya, Argentina, dan tak bisa lagi lanjut membela PSS hingga akhir musim kompetisi.
Eks pemain River Plate, Velez Sarsfield, Olimpo, dan Independiente itu telah divonis dokter tim tak dapat melanjutkan laga lagi dalam waktu dekat, usai laga terahirnya membela PSS Sleman kontra Persija Jakarta 24 Oktober 2019 lalu.
Dalam laga kontra Persija yang berakhir 0-0 lalu itu, eks pemain Timnas Argentina U-17 tersebut bertubrukan keras dengan seorang gelandang Macan Kemayoran dan ternyata cedera parah.
Hasil pemeriksaan magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), ulu hati eks pemain Johor Darul Ta'zim itu sobek tiga sentimeter sehingga harus menjalani terapi panjang yang membuatnya harus absen hingga akhir musim.
"Kontrak saya dengan PSS Sleman sebenarnya berakhir Desember 2019 nanti, tapi dokter merekomendasikan saya pulang dulu (ke Argentina) agar bisa fokus penyembuhan di sana," ujar Brian ditemui Tempo di sela laga.
Pemain asing yang dikontrak PSS Sleman pertama kali untuk menjalani musim kompetisi 2019 ini mengaku pasrah atas kondisinya itu. Brian juga tak menyalahkan keadaannya meski menjadi pemain asing pertama PSS Sleman yang pertama harus hengkang dari klub asuhan Seto Nurdiyantoro itu.
"Saya tak bisa membenci dan menyalahkan keadaan saya. Dalam sepak bola cedera seperti ini tidak bisa diduga," ujar pemain yang pernah melakoni kompetisi di Liga Malaysia, Cile dan Ekuador itu.
Pemain yang nyaris berlabuh ke tim asal Mesir, ENPPI SC, sebelum akhirnya bergabung PSS Sleman itu menuturkan, belum tahu rencananya ke depan pasca pulih dari cederanya itu.
"Saya belum tahun ke depan nanti seperti apa. Yang jelas saat ini tak ada yang lebih penting bagi saya selain menyembuhkan cedera ini," ujarnya.
Brian menjadi legiun asing pertama yang secara resmi direkrut PSS Sleman usai merampungkan proses penandatanganan kontrak pada 1 Maret 2019 lalu.
Brian saat itu memilih bergabung dengan PSS Sleman karena merasa cocok dengan atmosfer kompetisi sepak bola Indonesia serta pendukung PSS Sleman yang militan.
PSS Sleman pun lantas menjadi tim kedua di Asia yang dibela Brian usai berakhir kontraknya bersama tim Johor Darul Ta'zim Malaysia di musim 2017.
PSS Sleman cukup beruntung mendapatkan Brian, sang playmaker produktif Elang Jawa yang terus saling bersaing mencetak gol bersama penyerang PSS asal Ukraina, Yevhen Bokhasvili yang kini mengantongi 13 gol.
Moncernya Brian mengarungi kompetisi bersama PSS yang menjadi tim promosi di Liga 1 2019, membuatnya tak urung diburu tim lain untuk mendapatkanya. Namun, dengan kualitas yang dimilikinya, Brian jelas tak akan masuk daftar lego oleh PSS Sleman.
Bahkan Chief Executive Officer (CEO) PT Putera Sleman Sembada (PT PSS) Fatih Chabanto akhir September 2019 sudah mulai bernegosiasi dengan sejumlah pemain agar tetap bertahan membela PSS di musim kompetisi 2020. Salah satunya dengan Brian Ferreira. Namun rencana itu kemungkinan akan dikaji ulang pasca Brian cedera.
Meski pemain yang mengidolakan Juan Roman Riquelme itu pernah menyatakan belum berminat hengkang dari PSS sampai kontrak berakhir pada Desember 2019, namun tak ada satu jaminan pun Brian bakal kembali Indonesia jika penyembuhan cederanya belum tuntas.
Suporter Elang Jawa mungkin boleh sedikit menyimpan harapan jika nyawa tengah PSS itu bakal merumput kembali musim kompetisi 2020 nanti dengan seragam hijau kebanggaan Sleman itu. Khususnya saat menyimak pidato perpisahan Brian di lapangan usai laga PSS Sleman vs Bali United di Maguwoharjo pada Rabu 6 November 2019.
Pada kesempatan itu, Brian mengucapkan terima kasihnya atas dukungan dari pelatih, pemain, manajemen, dan terutama suporter PSS yang luar biasa. Menurutnya, bersama PSS, ia menjalani musim kompetisi yang berkesan dan tak terlupakan.
"Saya sebenarnya belum bisa menentukan musim depan akan seperti apa. Tapi, dengan besarnya dukungan kalian di PSS, saya tetap akan prioritaskan tim ini musim depan. Semoga kita bisa berjodoh lagi," ujar Brian yang disambut riuh tepuk tangan para suporter PSS Sleman sambil mengelukan namanya.

PRIBADI WICAKSONO
text:
Leave PSS Sleman, Brian Ferreira: Hopefully we will be married again
Nov 7 2019, 03:58 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The expression of PSS Sleman attacking midfielder Brian Ferreira looked cold when he watched his team struggling to beat the top of the 2019 League 1 standings, Bali United at the Maguwoharjo Sleman Stadium on Wednesday afternoon, 6 November 2019.
The 25-year-old Argentine-Iraqi player, seen from the VVIP spectator seat Maguwoharjo Stadium, only occasionally looked exasperated when his colleague got a golden opportunity, but failed to execute it into a goal.
PSS Sleman had to end their home match against Bali United that afternoon with a score of 0-0, without the reinforcement of Brian, who was absent from the last three Super Hawk Javanese games, because the injury never recovered.
After the PSS match against Bali, the Iraqi passport player dropped from his stands then walked towards the middle of the field and said goodbye with emotion before the tens of thousands of PSS supporters who packed the stadium.
The second highest scoring machine for Laskar Sembada, which has played 20 matches with nine goals and five passes, said goodbye to return to his hometown, Argentina, and could no longer continue to defend PSS until the end of the season.
The former River Plate player, Velez Sarsfield, Olimpo, and Independiente has been sentenced by the team doctor to be unable to continue the fight again in the near future, after the last fight defending PSS Sleman counter Persija Jakarta 24 October 2019.
In the match against Persija which ended 0-0 then, the former Argentina U-17 national team player collided hard with a Macan Kemayoran midfielder and was seriously injured.
The results of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) examination, the heart of the former Johor Darul Ta'zim player was torn by three centimeters so he had to undergo lengthy therapy which made him absent until the end of the season.
"My contract with PSS Sleman actually ends in December 2019, but the doctor recommends that I go home first (to Argentina) so I can focus on healing there," Brian said when met by Tempo during the match.
The foreign player, who was contracted by PSS Sleman for the first time to undergo the 2019 season, admitted he resigned himself to his condition. Brian also did not blame his situation despite being the first foreign player in PSS Sleman, who had to leave the Seto Nurdiyantoro club.
"I can not hate and blame my situation. In football injuries like this can not be expected," said the player who had diving in the League of Malaysia, Chile and Ecuador.
The player who almost anchored to the Egyptian team, ENPPI SC, before finally joining the Sleman PSS said, did not know his plans ahead after recovering from the injury.
"I will not be like that in the coming years. What is clear is that at the moment there is nothing more important for me than to heal this injury," he said.
Brian became the first foreign legion to be officially recruited by PSS Sleman after completing the contract signing process on 1 March 2019.
Brian then chose to join the PSS Sleman because he felt that he was well-suited to the atmosphere of the Indonesian football competition and the militant supporters of PSS Sleman.
PSS Sleman then became the second team in Asia that Brian defended after his contract ended with the Johor Darul Ta'zim Malaysia team in the 2017 season.
PSS Sleman was fortunate enough to get Brian, the prolific playmaker Elang Jawa who continued to compete with each other to score goals with PSS striker from Ukraine, Yevhen Bokhasvili who now has 13 goals.
Brian Moncer waded the competition with PSS who became the promotion team in League 1 2019, making it inevitable for other teams to get it. However, with its quality, Brian clearly will not be included in the Lego list by PSS Sleman.
Even the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of PT Putera Sleman Sembada (PT PSS) Fatih Chabanto at the end of September 2019 has begun to negotiate with a number of players to continue to defend PSS in the 2020 season. One of them is with Brian Ferreira. But the plan is likely to be reviewed after Brian injured.
Although the player who idolized Juan Roman Riquelme had stated that he was not yet interested in leaving PSS until the contract expires in December 2019, there is no guarantee Brian will return to Indonesia if the healing of the injury is not yet complete.
Javanese Elang Supporters may be a little hopeful if the middle life of the PSS will graze the 2020 season again with Sleman's green pride. Especially when listening to Brian's farewell speech on the field after the PSS Sleman vs Bali United match in Maguwoharjo on Wednesday 6 November 2019.
On that occasion, Brian thanked for the support of the coach, players, management, and especially the outstanding PSS supporters. According to him, with PSS, he underwent a memorable and unforgettable season.
"I actually have not been able to determine what the next season will be like. But, with the amount of your support in PSS, I will still prioritize this team next season. Hopefully we can be paired again," said Brian, who was greeted with applause from PSS Sleman supporters while complaining the name.
